Introduction

Email aliasing is a privacy-focused technique that allows you to create multiple email addresses that forward to your primary inbox. This guide analyzes the top email aliasing providers, comparing their features, pricing, and policies to help you make an informed decision and take control of your digital identity.

Why Use Email Aliasing

üõ°Ô∏è

Privacy Protection

Shield your real email address from data breaches and spam.

üìÅ

Organization

Categorize emails by source (shopping, newsletters, work, etc.).

üîí

Security

Identify compromised services and disable specific aliases.

üíº

Professional Flexibility

Use custom domains for business communications.

üö´

Spam Management

Block unwanted emails without changing your primary address.

Addy.io vs SimpleLogin

Addy.io

Independent email aliasing service developed by Will Browning, focusing on transparency and user control.

Strengths

  • Affordable entry-level pricing ($1/month lite plan)
  • Detailed bandwidth monitoring and controls
  • Comprehensive documentation and FAQ
  • Active development with responsive support
  • Advanced rules and filtering capabilities

Considerations

  • Single developer dependency
  • Stricter subscription ending policies
  • Limited server locations (Amsterdam, Warsaw)

SimpleLogin

Professional email aliasing service acquired by Proton, emphasizing enterprise reliability and integration.

Strengths

  • Backed by Proton's infrastructure and team
  • Generous free tier with unlimited bandwidth
  • Lenient subscription ending policies
  • Integration with Proton ecosystem
  • Enterprise-grade reliability

Considerations

  • Higher starting price for premium features
  • Fewer granular pricing options
  • Limited customization compared to independent alternatives

Technical Specifications

Category Addy.io SimpleLogin

Email Size Limit 25MB 25MB

Subscription Policies

What Happens When Your Subscription Ends

Only free tier limits remain active		 ‚úÖ All continue working

Migration Considerations

From Addy.io

Export your alias list before your subscription ends to avoid service disruption.

From SimpleLogin

Minimal risk during subscription lapses, making it safer for temporary financial constraints.

Decision Guide

Choose Addy.io If You:

  • Budget-conscious: Need affordable entry-level pricing.
  • Technical user: Want detailed controls and monitoring.
  • Flexible usage: Prefer granular plan options.
  • Active management: Don't mind managing subscription timing.
Visit Addy.io

Choose SimpleLogin If You:

  • Enterprise user: Need reliability and infrastructure backing.
  • Proton ecosystem: Already use Proton services.
  • Subscription flexibility: Want lenient cancellation policies.
  • Set-and-forget: Prefer minimal maintenance.
Visit SimpleLogin
